quotes.quote: Your intellect may be confused, but your emotions will never lie to you.
The most confused we ever get is when we're trying to convince our heads of something our heart knows is a lie.
Anyone who isn't confused, really doesn't understand the situation.
If I look confused it is because I am thinking.
If you're not confused, you're not paying attention.
Today, if you are not confused, you are not thinking clearly.
Whenever I'm confused about something, I ask God to reveal the answers to my questions, and he does.
Someday, everything will make perfect sense. So for now, laugh at the confusion, smile through the tears, be strong and keep reminding your self that everything happens for a reason.
You can't follow your heart when it is more confused than your head.
However confused the scene of our life appears, however torn we may be who now do face that scene, it can be faced, and we can go on to be whole.
I am both happy and sad at the same time, and I'm still trying to figure out how that could be.
When you don't know where to start, just go to a place you miss so much.
Confused? Confusion is good. It's an excellent place to learn something new from.
If confusion is the first step to knowledge, I must be a genius.
I'm not confused, I'm just well mixed.
Sometimes I'm confused by what I think is really obvious. But what I think is really obvious obviously isn't obvious
Love is when two people who care for each other get confused.
For I am a bear of very little brain and long words bother me.
The more you explain it, the more I don't understand it.
The little waiter's eyebrows wandered about his forehead in confusion.
It's funny. All you have to do is say something nobody understands and they'll do practically anything you want them to.
To be given permission to be confused -- and remain confused -- for as long as it takes would have been a huge gift.
To cut off the confusion and accept an answer just because it's too scary not to have an answer is a good way to get the wrong answer.
I pretty much try to stay in a constant state of confusion just because of the expression it leaves on my face.
We often confuse what we wish for with what is.
I was just stock in the middle, vague and undefined.
I am here; and here is nowhere in particular.
We are buried beneath the weight of information, which is being confused with knowledge; quantity is being confused with abundance and wealth with happiness. We are monkeys with money and guns.
If you are sure you understand everything that is going on, you are hopelessly confused.
It is difficult to know at what moment love begins; it is less difficult to know that it has begun.
You always admire what you really don't understand.
People always seemed to know half of history, and to get it confused with the other half.
A good sacrifice is one that is not necessarily sound but leaves your opponent dazed and confused.
The good die young but not always. The wicked prevail but not consistently. I am confused by life, and I feel safe within the confines of the theatre.
Confusion now hath made his masterpiece.
Without censorship, things can get terribly confused in the public mind.
Never confuse a single defeat with a final defeat.
Haters are confused admirers who can’t understand why everybody else likes you.
We have confused the free with the free and easy.
We feel unhappy and confused with our life when we don't do the focus or calling that God  has on our life.
People don't expect too much from literature. They just want to know they're not alone with being confused.
The mind that engages in subjects of too great variety becomes confused and weakened.
Confusion is the welcome mat at the door of creativity.
The heresies we ought to fear are those that can be confused with orthodoxy.
When both a speaker and an audience are confused, the speech is profound.
Right is right, and wrong is wrong, and when people start getting it confused, that means they need to sit down with some real people.
Confused by thoughts, we experience duality in life. Unencumbered by ideas, the enlightened see the one Reality.
A great many of us have confused change with progress.
